message.content:
We need to identify the transactions that record depreciation. In our “problem” table the only rows with a type of “Depreciation” are the two rows with id:

• Depreciation20240101001 – with an amount of 45745.8  
• Depreciation20240201002 – with an amount of 81887.42

Since there is no accumulated depreciation carried forward in the initial entries (the “Initial…” rows show the starting asset and cash balances but no depreciation), we assume that the accumulated depreciation opening balance is zero.

Then to get the balance‐sheet “end” value (the current accumulated depreciation) you simply add in all the depreciation postings in the period. That is:

  Accumulated Depreciation End Value = 0.00 + 45745.8 + 81887.42  
                   = 127633.22

Thus the solution is:

{
  "solution": {
    "Accumulated Depreciation Initial Value": "0.00",
    "Accumulated Depreciation End Value": "127633.22"
  }
}
